In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can do it using Julia DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
This function takes a `DataFrame` as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this new column are the year and month of each date in the original `dt` column, concatenated together into an integer format "yyyymm".

Here's how you can use this function:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 29), DateTime(2023, 3, 31)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will return a new `DataFrame` with an additional column `ym`. The first row of this new column would be "202101", the second row would be "202202" and so on.
